conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph of two objects moving in the same direction from the same initial location.
At t1, object A has a velocity of v0, and object B has a velocity of 0.
The distance between two objects moving in opposite directions is maximized when their relative velocity is zero.
From the graph, the relative velocity is zero at t2, where both objects have the same velocity.
Since the relative velocity is zero at t2, the distance between them is maximized at this point.
At t2, both objects have the same velocity, and the graph shows that the distance between them is at its maximum.
Conclude that the two objects are farthest apart at t2.
